metadata.title: CVE-2020-13844 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
Arm Armv8-A core implementations utilizing speculative execution past unconditional changes in control flow may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to an attacker with local user access via a side-channel analysis, aka "straight-line speculation."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-13844` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cpp-10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
g++-10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
g++-10-multilib - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gcc-10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gcc-10-base - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gcc-10-hppa64-linux-gnu - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gcc-10-locales - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gcc-10-multilib - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gcc-10-offload-nvptx - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gcc-10-source - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gcc-10-test-results - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gccbrig-10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gccgo-10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gccgo-10-multilib - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gdc-10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gdc-10-multilib - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gfortran-10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gfortran-10-multilib - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gm2-10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gnat-10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gobjc++-10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gobjc++-10-multilib - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gobjc-10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
gobjc-10-multilib - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
lib32go16 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
lib32gphobos1 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
lib64go16 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
lib64gphobos1 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
libgm2-15 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
libgnat-10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
libgnat-util10 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
libgo16 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
libgomp-plugin-hsa1 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
libgphobos1 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
libstdc++-10-pic - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
libx32go16 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
libx32gphobos1 - 10.2.0-5ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: sbeattie> gcc-3.3 only provides libstdc++5 mdeslaur> Fixing this in stable release would likely require rebuilding the whole archive using the fixed compiler. Deferring CVE for now until further information is available. sbeattie> fixed upstream in 10.3.0 rodrigo-zaiden> backport to older versions of llvm-toolchain is risky and is likely to introduce regressions.

criterions.comment: gcc-10 package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.2.0-5ubuntu1').
gcc-3.3 package in kinetic is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
gcc-9 package in kinetic is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
